title: Prodigy star Keith Flint's possessions are being sold at auction to settle debts

The Prodigy’s Keith Flint's possessions are being sold at auction to settle debts.

The star owed roughly £7.3 million in debts and taxes when he died at the age of 49 at his mansion earlier this year.

His personal belongings, which have been divided into 170 lots, can be brought by the highest bidder at auction in November.

The collection that is up for grabs includes music awards, clothing and furniture and the items will go under the hammer in Cambridge at Cheffins Fine Art auctioneers.

Speaking ahead of the auction, Martin Millard, director at the auctioneers, said: "The sale is full of interesting items which give an insight into Keith's personal life and highlight the difference between his stage persona and his private life.

(Image: PA)

"Valuing items with such provenance is almost impossible, and therefore we will not be publishing any pre-sale estimates, but expect there to be lots to cater to most budgets."

Available for purchase, are music awards and presentation discs from around the world, commemorating the global success of The Prodigy.

From his personal wardrobe, items include Japanese items, and hoodies, T-shirts and shirts.

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

Furniture and artwork from the star's home will go under the hammer including a bespoke bed, constructed from oak planks and steel and decorated with entwined thorns - that he helped design.

There are also customised pieces from the renowned London store of designer furniture brand Jimmie Martin.

Keith's art collection includes a portrait presented on his 47th birthday from regulars at his pub, the Leather Bottle in Pleshey, Essex.

(Image: PA)

Other pieces reflect his love for motorsport, with both bikes and supercars featuring in large images.

Keith, who once took ownership of motorcycle team Team Traction Control, which won two Isle of Man TT races in 2015, had a number of motorcycle leather and elements which have been signed which are also being sold.

(Image: PA)

Keith was found by a friend at his Essex home in March.

A coroner later ruled there was not enough evidence to confirm the musician took his own life.

Details from the Probate Office show the frontman had significant debts at the time.
description: The Fire Starter hitmaker's personal belongings will now go under the hammer to raise funds
